subject: Investing
title: Decentralization: Why It Matters
description: A quick, practical guide to Decentralization: Why It Matters.

hook.text: When a single bank server crashes, millions lose access to their money. That's the risk of centralization.

buildup.text: Decentralization distributes control across many independent nodes so no single point can fail or censor.

discovery.text: Bitcoin has over 15,000 nodes worldwide. Shutting it down would require controlling all of them at once.

twist.text: True decentralization is a spectrum. Many 'decentralized' projects have a few entities controlling most nodes.

climax.text: For investors, the degree of decentralization affects censorship resistance, security, and regulatory risk.

punchline.text: Decentralization isn't binary. More nodes, more resilience, more trust.

quiz.question: Why does decentralization matter for blockchains?
options: No single point can fail or censor the network
